titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Acting Resident at Bushire to Neil Benjamin Edmonstone, Secretary in the Secret, Political and Foreign Department, Fort William, Calcutta

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage; there are a number of small holes at various points, which makes some small sections tricky to read. In addition, a hole has partially obscured the signature of the letter.

mods.abstract: The letter is enclosing a range of correspondence and a list of these items included in the margin; only the three letters listed below are transcribed in this volume. The correspondence is intended to outline the state of local affairs since Captain Charles Pasley's departure.Three enclosures:1. Letter from William Bruce to Captain Charles Pasley, Acting Envoy Extraordinary to Persia, dated 23 August 1808. The letter concerns correspondence that is being forwarded to the Captain, shipping movements to and from Bushire, the expected arrival of 500 men to garrison Karrack and the mysterious arrival in Bushire of Abdella Khan. The latter has expressed concern over the departure of General Malcolm and Captain Pasley to India and Bussorah [Basra] respectively.2. Letter from William Bruce to Captain Charles Pasley, Acting Envoy Extraordinary to Persia, dated 24 August 1808. The letter discusses a visit to the Resident by Mohumed Hossain Khan and Aga Mohumed Jaffer, who delivered Persian letters on behalf of Abdella Khan. During their visit the departure of General John Malcolm and Captain Pasley was discussed, as was why company goods had been shipped out from the factory at Bushire; for the latter the threat of the Wahabees [Wahabi] to Bushire is cited as the motivation. In addition to this, the subject of a building that the Shaik [Shaikh ‘Abd al-Rasūl Khān] is constructing against the wishes of the Government at Sheraz [Shiraz] is raised.3. Translation of a letter from William Bruce to Abdella Khan, dated 19 August 1808. William Bruce is explaining why Captain Pasley has left for Bussora [Basra] and that he has been deputed to act in Bushire on his behalf.
